summary: The Protect Vulnerable Immigrant Youth Act (S. 1965) aims to eliminate employment-based visa caps for abused, abandoned, and neglected children classified as special immigrant juveniles. Introduced by Senator Cortez Masto and cosponsors on June 5, 2025, the bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to remove these numerical limitations, allowing more qualified youth to obtain visas. The bill was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
